title: amane_kanata_(another_world)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]], it was debuted during her 3rd anniversary 3D live concert [i]"Another World"[/i] and has a [[fallen angel]] theme.

It consists of a [[black collar|black]] [[animal collar]], an  [[o-ring top|o-ring]] [[chest harness|chest]] [[o-ring harness|harness]] a [[black bra|black]] [[lace-trimmed bra|lace-trimmed]] [[strapless bra]], multiple [[arm strap|arm]] and [[wrist straps]] on her right arm and [[bandaged arm|bandages]] on her left arm, [[black gloves]], a large [[black belt]] with a large [[blue rose]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt]] with a [[gold trim]]med [[black skirt|black]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]]-length layers, and a layered [[overskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] layer and a [[torn skirt|torn]] blue layer, a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[blue thighhighs|blue thighhigh]] on her right leg an a [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]] and an [[ankle garter]]/[[anklet]] on her left leg, and [[black shoes|black]] [[pumps]].

Fitting with the fallen angel theme her halo is now [[blue halo|dark blue]], her [[colored inner hair]] is a darker shade of [[blue hair|blue]] and has a dark [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], her [[streaked hair|hair streaks]] are also purple now too and her wings are now darker with the [[gradient wings|gradient]] going from [[grey wings|grey]] to [[blue wings|dark blue]] and she has an [[multiple wings|additional]] pair of [[black wings]] pointing down.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair]] done in a [[half updo]] with [[double bun]]s.

title: sam_&_max
body: Sam and Max is an American franchise created by Steve Purcell. It originally began as a comic book series in 1987 before the franchise gained fame when it was turned into a point and click adventure game, Sam & Max Hit the Road, by Lucas Arts in 1993 on PC. It was later turned into an animated series, The Adventures of Sam & Max: Freelance Police, which aired for one season from 1997 to 1998. Sam and Max return in video game format in 2006 as a series of adventure games by Telltale Games.

title: uss_intrepid_(cv-11)
body:
A member of the [i]Essex[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1943, it earned eight battle stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]] and the [[Vietnam War]], and was a recovery vessel for several space missions. [i]Intrepid[/i] was decommissioned for the last time in 1974, and is currently a museum ship in [[New York City]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises such as [[Kantai Collection]].

title: los_angeles
body:
Los Angeles (often appreviated "LA") is a major city located in Southern [[California]], [[United States]]. It is the largest city in California and the second-largest city in the United States by population, after [[New York City]]. It is also large geographically: the greater Los Angeles area encompasses a vast metropolitan patchwork that stretches across approximately 503 square miles (1,302 square kilometers), including a number of outlying communities and suburbs. Los Angeles' Spanish translation, "The Angels", gives the city both its main nickname ("The City of Angels") as well as the name of one of its two Major League [[Baseball]] teams. 

Los Angeles is renowned for its entertainment industry, particularly Hollywood, which is the center of the American film and television industry. Many major film studios, production companies, and entertainment-related businesses are based in Los Angeles. The city is also known for its thriving music scene, hosting numerous concerts, festivals, and a variety of cultural events.

Los Angeles is also famous for its iconic landmarks, including the [[Hollywood Sign]], the Walk of Fame, Griffith Observatory, Santa Monica Pier, Universal Studios Hollywood, Getty Center, and many others. 

h4. Locations 
* [[Angel Stadium of Anaheim]]
* [[Disneyland]]

title: volkswagen_beetle
body:
The [b]Volkswagen Beetle[/b], officially the "Volkswagen Type 1", is a two-door, four passenger, rear-engine economy [[car]] manufactured and marketed by German automaker [[Volkswagen]] (VW) from 1938 until 2003.

Originated from an initiative of [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] to produce the "people's car", the Beetle is the longest-running and most-manufactured [[car]] of a single platform ever made. Because of its very cheap price and reliability It was the best selling civilian four wheeled motor vehicle during the [[Cold War]].

h4. See also

* [[Herbie (character)]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: new_york_city
body:
The largest city of the [[New York State|state of New York]]. It is also the largest city in the [[United States]] and a major commercial and cultural center. 

Founded by the Dutch as New Amsterdam, it was renamed by the English in honor of the Duke of York. Originally consisting only of Manhattan Island, it was rechartered in 1898 to include the five present-day boroughs of Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, and Staten Island. It is the main site of the [[9/11]] terrorist attack.

New York is the central location for many of [[Marvel]]'s comic series and superheroes, being home to Avengers Tower in the [[Avengers (series)|]] comics and the Baxter Building; the [[fantastic four|Fantastic Four's]] headquarters, as well as being the home city and main setting for [[Spider-Man]] and [[Daredevil]]'s stories.

title: quebec
body:
Use for posts referencing Quebec, such as the Quebecois Flag, Quebecois Sports teams such as the Montreal Canadiens, and/or depicting [[real world location]]s or culture such as food. 

Québec is a province of [[Canada]]. It is Canada's largest province by area, bordering Ontario in the west, Newfoundland and Labrador to the northeast, and New Brunswick to the southeast, and has coastal borders with Nunavut. 

The official language of the province is French. Quebec French (also known as Québécois) is the predominant variety, having some differences (primarily in pronunciations and vocabulary) when compared to European French. 

The province was settled by Paleo-Indians during the Last Glacial Maximum and was first explored by Europeans under Jacques Cartier in 1534, who would claim it for the Kingdom of France. France would continue to hold on to the colony until 1763, when ownership of the colony was transferred to the United Kingdom after the French and Indian War (AKA the Seven Years' War). It would later join the Dominion of Canada in 1867. In 1960, the Quiet Revolution would achieve major reforms throughout the province.

The capital of Québec is Québec City (French: Ville de Québec) and the largest cities are [[Montreal|Montréal]], Gatineau, Trois-Rivières, and Sherbrooke. 

Québec is the birthplace of [[poutine]] and is known for helping to popularize the sport of [[ice hockey]].

h4. See also

* [[Quebecois flag|Québécois flag]]
* [[Louisiana]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Quebec":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quebec]

[[Italy|Italian]] automobile manufacturer known for high-performance [[motor vehicle]]s. Almost all of their [[sports car]]s are powered by 12-cylinder engines, as is often tradition for high-end Italian automakers.

They also have a lesser known division producing agricultural [[tractor]]s, which are the company's original main line of products.

Lamborghini's main rivals include [[Ferrari]] and [[Porsche]].

title: animation_meme
body:
A short [[animated]] [[video]] typically set to [[audible music]]. These videos are then recreated by other animators with their own characters or characters from media franchises. These videos tend to be simple and repetitive, often focusing on dancing.

The format evolved on YouTube in the late 2000s when Japanese MAD trends such as [[Caramelldansen]] and [[Caipirinha (meme)|]] were imported to the site from NicoNico, with the first true animation meme being the Nya Nya Dance, posted by webkinzlid in 2009.

This tag should only be used on posts that explicitly call themselves such or are based on videos that were designed to be replicated, not [[parody|parodies]] in general.

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[meme]]
* [[parody]]

h4. External links

* "Fanlore: Animation Meme":https://fanlore.org/wiki/Animation_Meme
* "Know Your Meme: Animation Memes":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/animation-memes

title: coin_sword
body:
A coin sword (alternatively spelt as coin-sword), or cash-sword, are a type of Chinese numismatic charm that is a form of feng shui talisman primarily used in southern China to ward off evil spirits and malicious influences, especially those inducing fever. Coin-swords are also often used in Taoist rituals. Coin-swords are considered an "evil-warding sword" in China.

body:
3rd unit captain of the [[shinsengumi (gintama)|Shinsengumi]]. Based off of [[Saitou Hajime]].

A powerful combatant with a large [[orange hair|orange]] afro, leading him to be nicked "Wolfro". Doesn't say much, but is in reality incredibly shy and uses his face mask as an excuse to not say anything. Sleeps often.

title: don't_care_didn't_ask_(meme)
body:
Series of reaction images that indicate the poster's lack of desire to consider one's opinion, often citing racial or another kind of prejudice. Originated from an image of 50 cent showing two middle fingers captioned "Don't care didn't ask plus you're white".

A variant of the meme is "Do care, did ask".

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Don't Care, Didn't Ask / 50 Cent Middle Finger":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dont-care-didnt-ask-50-cent-middle-finger

title: thigh_sex
body:
A [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] in which a person rubs their [[penis]] in between their partner's closed [[thighs]]. Also known as intercrural or interfemoral sex, or sometimes by the Japanese term 'sumata' (すまた).

Not to be confused with [[kneepit sex]] or [[thigh straddling]]. Use [[grinding]] instead when the [[penis]] is rubbed directly on the [[pussy]] instead of between the [[thighs]].

This tag is somewhat of a misnomer because while the word [[sex]] is used, it shouldn't be tagged as such as well. Sex is only when the penis is inserted into the vaginal or anal cavities.

h4. See also

* [[frottage]]
* [[grinding]]
* [[kneepit sex]]
* [[Tag Group:Sex Acts]]

title: arsenal_bird
body: A boss from [[ace_combat_7|Ace Combat 7]]. The Arsenal Birds were automated airborne fortresses developed by Osea to assist in the defense of the International Space Elevator. After the outbreak of the Lighthouse War, both were hijacked by Erusea. The Arsenal Bird's armaments and defenses include missiles, lasers, and an energy shield, but the bulk of their offensive power is centered on the large numbers of drone fighters they carry, and can rapidly deploy into battle.

title: alicorn_(ace_combat)
body: A super-submarine that appears in [[ace_combat_7|Ace Combat 7's]] DLC missions. Intended as a successor to the [i]Scinfaxi[/i]-class submarines, [i]Alicorn[/i] is larger and more heavily-armed, carrying two short-range railguns, a longer-range one capable of firing nuclear shells, a large air wing, and VLS tubes. Bizarrely for a submarine, she does not carry torpedoes. Her captain was Matias Torres, who went insane and believed that the only way to stop the Lighthouse War was to use his ship's nuclear capabilities to kill one million people to save ten million more.
other_names: アリコーン(エースコンバット)

title: death
body:
Refers to the cessation of a living organism's vital function. Use this tag that features dead or dying people, creatures, or animals, or that implies a death has taken place.

If the corpse or cause of death isn't explicitly shown but you can infer a death has taken place, use [[implied death]].

For the Grim Reaper or other personifications of death, see [[Death (entity)]]. For the tarot card "Death", see [[Death (tarot)]].

h4. See also

title: fukuzawa_ayu_(redfalcon23)
body: Original character created by artist RedFalcon23, Ayu is a young girl in junior high who has been blind since birth but also harbors superhuman strength. She is a polite, curious girl who loves going on adventures. Her pet rabbit [[Chimu_(RedFalcon23)]] serves as her guide animal when there are no other humans around.

title: mazda_montgomery_(dlshowtime)
body: Original character belonging to artist DLShowtime. She is the daughter of his character Alexus Montgomery and inherited her mother's blue eyes, dog tags, large bust, and inhuman strength. She is adventurous, charismatic, and kindhearted. [[Sephira_Summers_(Parasyte123)]] is her half-sister as they share the same father.

title: chimu_(redfalcon23)
body: Chimu is a rabbit belonging to [[Fukuzawa_Ayu_(RedFalcon23)]] who doubles as her guide animal due to her blindness. He's been a part of her life for as long as she can remember and fancies himself a bit of a ladies man since so many girls are drawn to his cuteness. He and Ayu are also able to understand each other quite well and he's always watching over her like a guardian.

title: kasane_neko_(haru57928031)
body:
Unofficial cat girl design for [[Kasane Teto]] popularized by [[haru57928031]]. A redesign of her original [[UTAU]] outfit featuring a black hooded jacket, a backpack with a black cat sitting inside, sneakers, small detached wings, and a cat eared megaphone. She also has the [[hair bow]] of her [[Kasane Teto (SV)|SV]] design. Sometimes accompanied by a twin drill cat baguette.

title: jefuty_(bakery_girl)
body:
Main protagonist of [[Codename: Bakery Girl]] and its remake [[reverse collapse (series)|Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] alongside a pair of [[blue eyes]]. Clothing-wise, she commonly either wears a [[damaged|ragged]] [[brown coat]] with her left leg [[bandaged leg|bandaged]] while wielding a [[Mosin-Nagant]] or a [[white coat|white]] [[winter coat]] with [[black fur| black]] [[fur trim]]s while holding an [[anti-materiel rifle]] with a [[snow camouflage|snow/winter]] [[camouflage|camo]] pattern.

At the end of Chapter 1, it is revealed that Jefuty [spoilers]has the ability to transfer her memories towards other Jefutys upon death to aid them in their goal of escaping the URNC with her sister [[Lige (bakery girl)|]] towards the AU.[/spoilers]

title: rig_shokew
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]].

[b]ZM-S22S Rig Shokew[/b]

A mass-production version of the prototype ZMT-S12G [[Shokew]] [[Zanscare]] [[mobile suit]] with several improvements. The Rig Shokew has increased generator output, a new backpack, additional verniers for greater maneuverability, and a greater amount of more powerful thrusters for better speed and acceleration. 

A higher amount of titanium was incorporated in the alloy of its armor, giving it better durability. The Rig Shokew stands a meter taller, and the added size adds a bit to the empty weight, yet when fully-loaded it is lighter than the original Shokew.

title: iris_(pokemon)
body:
A [[Pokemon]] character.

In the games, Iris is a young, nature-loving girl and Unova's eighth Gym Leader in [[Pokemon BW|Pokémon White]]. Her specialty is Dragon-types, and she is [[Drayden (pokemon)|]]'s apprentice. Her main Pokémon is [[Haxorus]]. She returns in [[pokemon bw2|Pokémon Black and White 2]] as the new Champion of the Unova region.

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], she is also one of [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]]'s former companions. She has a [[Axew]] that lives in her hair. Like [[Misty (pokemon)|]], Iris is frequently critical of Ash's actions as a trainer, calling him childish. She aims to be a master of Dragon-type Pokémon, and must evolve her [[Axew]] into it's final stage, [[Haxorus]] to be considered one. She is also known for being the first naturally dark-skinned main character in the Pokémon series. She returns in [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys]] in her capacity as Champion of Unova, and battles Ash as he climbs the ranks of the World Coronation Series. [spoiler]Eventually, she joins Ash in the Masters Eight.[/spoilers]

h4. Official Art

title: pokemon_platinum
body:
The game [i]Pokémon Platinum[/i]. This is a subset of [[pokemon dppt]] (Pokémon Diamond, Pearl and Platinum).

Use this tag only for things that appear in [i]Platinum[/i] but don't appear in [i]Diamond and Pearl[/i]. This includes some [i]Platinum[/i]-exclusive characters and designs.

This tag is similar to [[pokemon emerald|Pokémon Emerald]].

h4. Outfits

* {{dawn_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Dawn wearing her [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{lucas_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Lucas wearing his [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Lucas (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{barry_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Barry wearing his [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Barry (pokemon)|]] for details.

h5. A note about the anime

* {{pokemon_dppt_(anime) winter_clothes}}
** Dawn wears winter clothes in the [i]Diamond & Pearl[/i] anime series too.
** Example: post #464226.
** In these cases, use [[pokemon dppt (anime)]] and [[winter clothes]] (don't use any game tags like [[pokemon platinum]] or [[pokemon dppt]]).

h4. Characters introduced in [i]Platinum[/i]

These characters were introduced in [i]Platinum[/i] and may be tagged [[pokemon platinum]] as well as [[pokemon dppt]].

They may appear in manga and anime, however. For posts exclusively referencing some manga or the anime, do not use any game tags like [[pokemon platinum]] or [[pokemon dppt]].

h5. Frontier Brains

* [[Argenta (pokemon)|]]
* [[Caitlin (pokemon)|]]

title: pokemon_emerald
body:
The game [i]Pokémon Emerald[/i]. This is a subset of [[pokemon rse]] (Pokémon Ruby, Sapphire, and Emerald).

Use this tag only for things that appear in [i]Emerald[/i] but don't appear in [i]Ruby and Sapphire[/i]. This includes some [i]Emerald[/i]-exclusive characters and designs.

This tag is similar to [[pokemon platinum|Pokémon Platinum]].

h4. Outfits

* {{may_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** May wearing her [i]Emerald[/i] outfit. See [[May (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{brendan_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** Brendan wearing his [i]Emerald[/i] outfit. See [[Brendan (pokemon)|]] for details.

h5. A note about the anime

* {{may_(pokemon) pokemon_dppt_(anime)}}
** May wears the same outfit in the [i]Diamond & Pearl[/i] anime series.
** Example: post #1100280.
** In these cases, use [[pokemon dppt (anime)]] (don't use any game tags like [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]]).

h4. Exclusive characters / roles

These are characters or roles exclusive to [i]Pokémon Emerald[/i]. They don't appear in any other games (outside of cameos).

They may however appear in manga and anime. For posts exclusively referencing some manga or the anime, don't use any game tags like [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]].

h5. Gym Leader

* [[Juan (pokemon)|]], the Gym Leader of Sootopolis City in [i]Pokémon Emerald[/i]. He does not appear in [i]RS[/i] or [i]ORAS[/i].

h5. Champion

* {{wallace_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** Wallace is the Hoenn Champion [i]Pokémon Emerald[/i]. So posts where he fills that role in a game context (as opposed to manga/anime context) such as post #753097 are tagged [[pokemon emerald]].

h5. Frontier Brains

* [[Anabel (pokemon)|]]
* [[Brandon (pokemon)|]]
* [[Greta (pokemon)|]]
* [[Lucy (pokemon)|]]
* [[Noland (pokemon)|]]
* [[Spenser (pokemon)|]]
* [[Tucker (pokemon)|]]

h5. A note about Pokémon SM

* {{anabel_(pokemon) pokemon_sm}}
** In [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]], [[Anabel (pokemon)|]] appears with long hair tied in a ponytail (as opposed to her short hair in [i]Emerald[/i]), and using a black coat and tie. In these cases, use [[pokemon sm]], not [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]].

h5. Scott

* [[Scott (pokemon)|]] is an exclusive [i]Pokémon Emerald[/i] character.

title: bonnie_(pokemon)
body:
[[Pokemon XY]] character.

In the [[Pokemon XY|game]], she is [[Clemont (pokemon)|]]'s little sister and assistant. She can assess how well the player has bonded with their Pokémon in [[Pokemon-Amie]].

In the [[Pokemon XY (anime)|anime]], she travels with [[ash ketchum|Ash]] in the Kalos region. An energetic and cheerful little girl who eagerly looks forward to the day she can become a Pokémon Trainer. This led her to ask her brother, [[Clemont (pokemon)|]], to let her "keep" the [[Dedenne]] that had been following them since they left Lumiose City. For some reason, she is also looking for a bride for her big brother. She will often ask young women if they will marry him, embarrassing Clemont to no end.

title: swim_swim
body: Character from [[Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku]]. "Swim Swim" is the name of the magical girl form of [[Sakanagi Ayana]]. As a magical girl she has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[drill hair|drill]] sidelocks and [[pink eyes]]. She wears [[bunny headphones]] on her head and [[goggles]] [[goggles around neck|around her neck]]. Her clothing consists mostly of a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[old school swimsuit|school swimsuit]], although she also wears a [[frills|frilled]] [[thigh strap]] around her left leg and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. She has what appear to be [[bat wings]] on her back.

title: luigi_torelli_(kancolle)
body:
Italian submarine Luigi Torelli, the fourth Marconi-class submarine, as depicted in [[Kantai Collection]], named after Italian scientific fellow and patriot "Luigi Torelli (9 February 1810 – 14 November 1887)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luigi_Torelli].

In-game, because of having a male name (and also sharing a name with [[Luigi|a certain plumber]]), she calls herself "Lu."

She is depicted as a [[flat_chest|flat-chested girl]] with [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[green eyes]] wearing initially a white [[hairband]] and black [[thighhighs|thigh-high boots]]. She wears a grey thigh-length [[sleeveless]] and skirted [[wetsuit]] with green accents. Her garb changes with each remodel: As [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25]] (or "Ui"), she gains [[arm warmers]], red, white, and black shoulder pads, and a black hairband. Then, upon becoming [[i-504 (kancolle)|I-504]] (or "Go"), she reverts to her white hairband, but is otherwise reduced to nothing else but a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[school swimsuit]]. Despite the changes in wardrobe, her standard submarine [[machinery]], with its grey and green livery, mostly stays the same.

Luigi Torelli has the unique distinction in the game as the shipgirl to serve all three Axis powers, representing one of the two ships that ever did so (the other being another Italian submarine [[Comandante Cappellini (kancolle)|]]). The historical submarine originally patrolled the Mediterranean Sea, sinking and damaging Greek and British commercial ships before surviving an attack by Vickers Wellington bombers using Leigh light on June 3, 1942. Due to her dimensions, she was deemed fit for long travels and thus was among seven submarines sent to the Far East in 1943, retaining her Italian crew despite being under Kriegsmarine command. After the new Italian government signed an armistice with the Allies the same year, the historal [i]Luigi Torelli[/i] was passed to full German command under the name [i]U.IT.25[/i] and took part in German war operations in the Pacific. After Germany's surrender in 1945, ex-[i]Luigi Torelli[/i]'s IJN custodians then took over control, renaming her [i]I-504[/i]. She was under the Japanese flag when she shot down a B-25 Mitchell bomber near the very end of the World War II in the Pacific, allegedly the last Axis naval success. She was captured by American forces in Kobe at the conclusion of the war and eventually scuttled by the US Navy in the Kii Channel on April 16, 1946.

h4. See also

* [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25 (Kantai Collection)]] 
* [[I-504 (kancolle)|]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wiki: Luigi Torelli":[https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Luigi_Torelli]
* "Wikipedia: Italian submarine Luigi Torelli":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_submarine_Luigi_Torelli]

title: idol_(rhythm_tengoku)
body:
A character from the game [[Rhythm Tengoku Gold]] of the [[Rhythm Tengoku]] series, who appears in the stage of the same name [[singing]] to her [[monkey_(rhythm_tengoku)|fans]] who applaud her. Her design in her debut game is based on the likeness of real-life [[idol]] Hashiguchi Erina, which primarily shows her either having [[twin braids]] or a [[short ponytail]]. She reappears in [[Rhythm Tengoku The Best+]] with a different design bearing the likeness of real-life idol Hario Arisa, which primarily shows her having a longer [[ponytail]], and sometimes is seen wearing an [[animal costume]].

She's known as "Pop Singer" in English, along with her stage being "Fan Club".

title: valentina_(super_mario_rpg)
body:
An antagonist from [[Super Mario RPG]]. She attempted to take over Nimbus Land in the midst of it's missing prince, locking away the [[Queen_nimbus_(super_mario_rpg)|Queen]] and [[king_nimbus_(super_mario_rpg)|King]] in the process. After spreading a lie to the townsfolk that the King is sick she begins also telling them that [[Dodo_(super_mario_rpg)|]] is their lost prince, and both pretend to be betrothed to each other in order to officially make Valentina queen.

She has [[pink skin]] and a [[curvy|hourglass figure]]. She wears a [[yellow_dress|yellowish]] [[strapless dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]] as well as [[pink footwear]]. Her eyes are [[black eyes|black]] and her eyelids are covered in [[blue eyeshadow]]. She has a [[green_bird|green]] [[parrot]] [[bird_on_head|on her head]] in place of hair, a parrot which is said to be a homage to [[Squawks]] from [[Donkey Kong Country]] [tn]"[1]":[https://web.archive.org/web/20230623084403/https://twitter.com/kurashimakaz/status/1672059029865263104][/tn].

In the original [[Super Nintendo]] release her official render shows her having a [[black pantyhose]], but in the [[Nintendo Switch]] remake this was removed entirely to have her legs completely exposed.

In Japanese her name is literally [[Margarita]], in reference to the [[cocktail_glass|cocktail]] she holds in her hand.

title: samurai_jack_(character)
body: Samurai Jack, also known as The Samurai or simply Jack, is a sobriquet adopted by the titular protagonist of the Cartoon Network/Adult Swim animated television series [[Samurai Jack]] (2001–2004; 2017). He was created by Genndy Tartakovsky and is voiced by Phil LaMarr. The character is introduced as a Japanese prince raised since youth as a samurai warrior, who trains under several teachers in order to destroy the demon Aku with his father's sword. However, before he can kill Aku, the demon sends him into the future, where his future self rules over Earth, which has become a post-apocalyptic dystopia, unopposed. Adopting the alias "Jack", the samurai makes it his mission to find a way back to his time and prevent this future from happening.

body:

[b]Megumi[/b] is one of [[Kanzaki Akihito]]'s childhood friends. She is an honor student who also enjoys watching as well as discussing anime.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[small breasts]].

title: sawatari_shizuku
body:
The main female protagonist in the second [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: wasurenagusa to eien no shoujo|Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo]][/i] (Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl).

[b]Shizuku[/b] is the childhood friend of [[Kanzaki Akihito]] who reunites with him after moving two years ago and not keeping in contact with him. She is a kind and energetic girl admired by everyone. Her hobbies and interests include rhythmic gymnastics and sweets, even though concerned about her weight.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[hair_flower|flower hair ornament]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[striped necktie]], [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[shoes]].

title: kanzaki_akihito
body:
The main protagonist in the second [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: wasurenagusa to eien no shoujo|Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo]][/i] (Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl).

After his childhood heart problems got worse, as time went on [b]Akihito[/b] refused to go to school and has turned into the opposite of his past social self, who used to be good at studying, exercising, and getting along with everyone. This changes when he is reunited with his childhood friend and crush [[Sawatari Shizuku]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears a [[school uniform]]: [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] and [[black pants]].

It follows [[Kanzaki Akihito]], a young boy with heart problems. His mind was darkened mostly by his childhood friend and first love [[Sawatari Shizuku]], whom he feels betrayed by. title: amano_pikamee
body:
A former bilingual Japanese [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], member of [[VOMS]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3975769 for her original design, - for her dinosaur hood design, - for her VOMS Black design, post #5223579 for Isekai Pikamee, - for Isekai Kimono, and post #5701038 for Isekai Monster.[/tn]

She has received a number of design updates since her debut, generally coinciding with her anniversary - in March 2021, alongside updates for her regular Live2D, she received a second form, in which she wears a [[dinosaur hood]] and has shrunk to the size of a child (going from 135cm to around 90cm), while maintaining arm length. In March 2022, she received three more forms, the first, alongside everyone else in VOMS, this time themed around urban styling (referred to as VOMS Black), the second turning her into a child (referred to as Isekai Pikamee), and the third giving her new child look a kimono and long hair. Later, in September, she would receive another form for her child look, giving her a powered-up lightning monster form. Isekai Pikamee, in contrast to her other forms, was handled by an artist other than GYARI, that being [[Shiratama (shiratamaco)|]].

Pikamee announced her graduation on 1 March 2023, effective on 31 March.

h4. See also
* [[Amano Pikamee (artist)]]
* [[Agomy (Amano Pikamee)|]] - Pikamee's IRL friend
* [[Socks (Amano Pikamee)|]] - Pikamee's real life pet cat
* [[Tomoe (Amano Pikamee)|]] - Pikamee's wooden spatula

body: Kim Dong Hwan is a character in the [[Fatal Fury]] series who debuted in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], the son of [[Kim Kaphwan]] and elder brother of [[Kim Jae Hoon]], trained in [[taekwondo]]. Of the brothers, Dong Hwan is the cocky talented slacker. He has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]] and wears a black-and-red [[dobok]]. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], after a scolding by father Kim for being a little too irresponsible, Dong Hwan is taking things a little more seriously; in addition, he still wears his black-and-red dobok pants, but now he sports an exposed [[tank top]] with a [[jacket around waist|jacket tied around his waist]].

title: tomodachi_life
body:
A life-simulation game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]] by [[Nintendo]] featuring [[Mii_(Nintendo)|Miis]], initially released in 2013 as a sequel to the Japan-exclusive Nintendo DS game [i]Tomodachi Collection[/i] from 2009. The 3DS game would later be released in June 2014 in North America, Europe and Australia, and would get a Korean version in July 2014.

The game is titled [i]Tomodachi Collection: New Life[/i] (トモダチコレクション 新生活 [i]Tomodachi Collection Shinseikatsu[/i]) in Japan, while Tomodachi Life was renamed as [i]Friend Gathering Apartment[/i] (친구모아 아파트 [i]Chingumoa Apateu[/i]) in South Korea.

A sequel, [i][[Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream]][/i] (トモダチコレクション わくわく生活 [i]Tomodachi Collection Wakuwaku Seikatsu[/i]) is scheduled to be released in 2026 for the [[Nintendo Switch]].

title: riding_machine
body:
([i]Jouba[/i] machine)

A machine that simulates the effects of [[horseback riding]]. Exercises seldom used muscles in the dorsal and abdominal regions.

Although not intended for sexual use, it was suggestively and famously featured in several fanmade [[Idolmaster]] videos. 

Not to be confused with a [[mechanical bull]], which is a similar concept, but considerably more vigorous (and would make a poor sex toy on account of its habit of flinging its rider to the floor). Also not be confused with a [[Sybian]], which IS for sexual use and only borrows the straddling position of a riding machine.

title: tezuka_osamu
body:
[b]Tezuka Osamu[/b] (born 3 November 1928 – 9 February 1989) was a legendary artist and mangaka. Also known as the [b]God of Manga[/b] ([i]"Manga No Kami-Sama"[/i]) and the [b]Godfather of Anime[/b]. Said to be responsible for the "big wide eyes" (actually inspired by Tezuka's admiration to the works of Walt [[Disney]]) and [[bishounen]] artstyle of characters that has prevailed in anime and manga up to these days.

Creator of [[Tetsuwan Atom]], [[Magma Taishi]], [[Jungle Taitei]], [i][[Pluto (tetsuwan atom)|]][/i], [[Metropolis]], [[Black Jack (series)|]], [[Don Dracula]], [[Buddha (tezuka osamu)|]], [[Adolf (tezuka osamu)|]], [[Hi no Tori]], [[Ribbon no Kishi]], [[Dororo_(tezuka)|]] and many many other classic manga, all considered part of [[Tezuka's Star System]].

Tezuka Osamu is by far the most prolific manga creator in the entire medium, having created about 700 different titles of original works. He has brought many conventions that have laid the foundations for many genres from shonen to seinen.

He graduated as a medical doctor, but never worked as such to focus in his mangaka work.

This tag is for the work done by Osamu, for posts that feature Osamu (and his self-insert), uses [[Tezuka Osamu (character)]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Tezuka Osamu (character)]]
* [[Tezuka Osamu (style)]]

title: the_croods
body: The Croods (also known as Crood Awakening) is a 2013 American animated adventure comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by 20th Century Fox. The film was directed by Chris Sanders and Kirk DeMicco, both of whom also wrote the screenplay and were credited with conceiving the story alongside John Cleese. The film stars the voices of [[Nicolas Cage]], [[Emma Stone]], [[Ryan Reynolds]], Catherine Keener, Clark Duke, and Cloris Leachman. The film is set in a fictional prehistoric Pliocene era known as "The Croodaceous" (a prehistoric period which contains fictional creatures, most of which are hybrids of existing animals, like the Cockrat, and some may be original.) when Grug, patriarch of the Croods, is threatened by the arrival of a genius named Guy, who comes up with revolutionary new inventions as they trek through a dangerous but exotic land in search of a new home.

title: monsters_vs._aliens
body: Monsters vs. Aliens is a 2009 American animated science fiction comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by Paramount Pictures. The film was directed by Conrad Vernon and Rob Letterman from a screenplay written by Letterman, Maya Forbes, Wally Wolodarsky, and the writing team of Jonathan Aibel and Glenn Berger based on a story by Vernon and Letterman. Featuring the voices of Reese Witherspoon, Seth Rogen, Hugh Laurie, Will Arnett, Kiefer Sutherland, Rainn Wilson, [[Paul Rudd]], and Stephen Colbert, the film involves a group of misfit monsters hired by the United States Armed Forces to stop the invasion of an extraterrestrial villain and save the world in exchange for freedom.

title: over_the_hedge
body: Over the Hedge is a 2006 American animated heist comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation SKG. Based on the comic strip of the same name, the film was directed by Tim Johnson and Karey Kirkpatrick from a screenplay by Len Blum, Lorne Cameron, David Hoselton and Kirkpatrick, and features the voices of Bruce Willis, Garry Shandling, Steve Carell, [[William Shatner]], Wanda Sykes and Nick Nolte. Set in Indiana, the plot follows RJ, a raccoon who is forced to deliver food to a bear named Vincent after accidentally destroying his stockpile of food, whereupon he manipulates a family of woodland animals who have recently awakened from hibernation into helping him steal food in order to speed up the process.

Worn over the shirt is a typically [[short dress|short]], [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[black dress|black]] and [[blue dress|blue]], [[sleeveless dress]] with [[double-breasted]] buttons.

The male uniform typically consists of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] [[plaid necktie]], and [[black pants]].

title: i-203_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine [i]I-203[/i]. Nicknamed "Fuumii". Character design by [[Hoshiakari_(c2_kikan)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice Actor)|]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with long [[sidelocks]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a two-piece [[nontraditional school swimsuit]]: [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]] and a [[white neckerchief]], and a short dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pencil skirt]] that conceals the lower half of a school swimsuit. She also wears [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] that bear her name. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces held by straps to her sides, and [[dual wielding|two]] 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s as [[handgun]]s. 

She made an initial appearance in the "May page of the 2021 Kancolle Calendar":[/posts/4272300] alongside [[I-47_(kancolle)|]] before being formally introduced into the game through the 2021 Spring Event.

title: spider-man_(toei)
body:
A 1978 live-action [[tokusatsu]] show loosely based on the [i][[Spider-Man (series)|]][/i] series, produced by Toei Company, Ltd, following in the vein of [i][[Kamen Rider]][/i] and the Ishinomori [i][[Super Sentai]][/i] seasons. The series follows a man named [[Yamashiro Takuya]], who transforms into the titular "Emissary from Hell" to fight villains with his [[mecha]] [[Leopardon]].

Toei would later reuse the concept of heroes and mecha for [i][[Super Sentai]][/i] series that would follow this show, starting with [i][[Battle Fever J]][/i], also co-produced with Marvel (along with [i][[Denshi Sentai Denziman]][/i] and [i][[Taiyou Sentai Sun Vulcan]][/i] after).

This series' version of Spider-Man made an appearance in the [i][[Spider-Verse (comics)|]][/i] comic events, and is slated to appear in the sequel to [i][[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]][/i]. In his appearance in 2025's [i]Spider-Verse vs. Venomverse #3[/i], he would receive a brand new Ishinomori-inspired design. He's also frequently referred to by Western fans as [i]Supaidaman[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man (Japanese TV series)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_(Japanese_TV_series)

title: lowrider
body:
A [[car]] specially modified so that it sits very low to the ground, originating in the Mexican-American culture of California.

Lowriders often also sport highly ornamental wheels (typically with wire spokes) and/or body work, showing off the individual owner's work on the vehicle, as well as hydraulic suspension systems that allow the driver to control the ride height or even bounce the vehicle around.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lowrider":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowrider]

title: the_boss_baby
body: The Boss Baby is a 2017 American animated spy comedy film, produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by [[20th_century_studios|20th Century Fox]]. Loosely based on the 2010 picture book of the same name by Marla Frazee, it was directed by Tom McGrath from a screenplay by Michael McCullers, and stars the voices of Alec Baldwin as the title character, along with Steve Buscemi, Jimmy Kimmel, Lisa Kudrow, Miles Bakshi, and [[Tobey Maguire]]. The first installment in The Boss Baby franchise, the plot follows a boy helping his baby brother who is a secret agent in the war for adults' love between babies and puppies.

title: creedence_clearwater_revival
body:
[b]Creedence Clearwater Revival[/b] was an American rock band composed of lead vocalist, lead guitarist, and primary songwriter John Fogerty, his brother, rhythm guitarist Tom Fogerty, bassist Stu Cook, and drummer Doug Clifford. The band began in 1959 as the Blue Velvets before settling with their current name in 1967. After producing several hit songs, the band disbanded in 1972 due to animosity and disagreements between the band members.

The band's most famous song was their 1969 hit song, "[I]Fortunate Son[/I]", released during the growing backlash against America's involvement in the [[Vietnam War]].

body:
[b]Clover[/b] (オタケ, Otake) is a character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends Arceus]][/i]. She is the middle sister of the Miss Fortunes.

[spoiler]Clover is a former member of both the Diamond Clan and the Galaxy Expedition Team.[/spoiler]

Clover has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and [[small breasts]] or [[flat chest]]. Her [[makeup]] includes [[red eyeshadow|red]] and [[blue eyeshadow]]. She wears rounded [[triangle earrings]], a [[sarashi]], an [[open jacket|open]] and [[torn jacket|torn]] [[blue jacket]] and a [[torn skirt|torn]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], both resembling the [[Ginkgo Guild uniform]], a [[brown belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts under skirt|bike shorts under her skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]] from the [[Diamond Clan outfit]]. She also carries small bags similar to carried by the Ginkgo Guild.

title: nise-shiki
body:
Nise Shiki (literally [b]Fake Shiki[/b]) is the true antagonist of the main story in [[Tsukihime]] PLUS-DISC, [i]"Alliance of Illusionary Eyes"[/i] (幻視同盟). 

Having the ability to "see" into the past of those he passes by, he becomes obsessed with [[Tohno Shiki]] after accidentally peering into his memories. He then begins impersonating Shiki and becomes a serial killer, finding life to be meaningless while testing [[Seo Akira]]'s future predictive ability.

His real name is never revealed.

title: imperialdramon
body:
An Ultimate-level Ancient Dragon  [[Digimon (creature)|]]. Traditionally shown to evolve from [[Paildramon]], it is featured in [[Digimon Adventure 02]] as the Jogressed Partner Digimon of [[Motomiya Daisuke]] and [[Ichijouji Ken]]. Its title is "Ruling Emperor Dragon" (君臨する皇帝竜, [i]Kunrin-suru Koutei-Ryuu[/i]).

In all of its guises, Imperialdramon bears [[red eyes]] and [[white hair]].

Imperialdramon has a number of forms and variants.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode|Dragon Mode]] — A quadrupedal [[dragon]] Digimon with huge, sharp claws [[claws]] on its forelegs, [[oversized wings|large]] [[wings]] and a [[cannon]] mounted on its back. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode|Fighter Mode]] — A bipedal dragon Digimon that has assumed a humanoid stance. Its cannon has moved to its right arm, and it now boast humanoid hands. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Paladin Mode|Paladin Mode]] — A further evolution of Fighter Mode that has gained [[Omegamon]]'s power, channeled through the [[Omega Blade]] [[greatsword]] in its hand. Vaccine attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode (Black)|Dragon Mode (Black)]] — A black-colored variant of Dragon Mode that has surrendered to its destructive urges. Notably, it has a [[blue tongue]] and palate. Virus attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode (Black)|Fighter Mode (Black)]] — A black-colored variant of Fighter Mode that has tamed the rampant power of its Dragon Mode and awakened to a heart of evil. It notably features its cannon on its left arm, of which it can extend its heat sinks to form a lance of energy. The crown on its head features a [[third eye]]. Virus attribute.

title: akigumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akigumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a long [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her right eye]]. Due to historical confusion on what class she was in, she wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is a hybrid of the styles seen in the [i]Kagerou[/i]- and [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class: her bridge and foremast to her back with a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]], a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

Due to her lines (and the fact that her crew illustrated the sinking [[Hornet (kancolle)|]] in the battle of the Santa Cruz Islands), she is often portrayed as a manga artist and is sometimes shown "being involved in doujinshi":/pools/9514. 

The historical [i]Akigumo[/i] was initially grouped with the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class by historians. This was due to her following the [i]-gumo[/i] naming scheme and because the [i]Kagerou[/i] and [i]Yuugumo[/i]-classes were quite similar in design. Researchers later found documents in 1994 indicating that she was actually meant to be the last of the [i]Kagerou[/i]-class.

[i]Designation: LSTR-512[/i]

Protagonist of [[SIGNALIS]].
German for "[[Magpie]]"

After her ship crash-lands on a remote, snow-covered planet, the [[android|Replika]] Elster sets out to look for her missing crew member. In her search she wanders through the ruins of a seemingly abandoned underground labor camp, surreal visions of cosmic horror, and flashbacks to a past that isn't hers. As the lines between reality and dream blur, Elster has to venture into the depths below the planet's surface to learn what has happened to her and why - but mysterious encoded radio signals and a Replika with dark intentions are not the only obstacles she has to overcome along the way.

body:
A Chinese web comic by Samanhua (飒漫画) and Tian Ping, and illustrated by [[Xiao Xiao Zuowen]]. Its English name is “Breaking Through 3000 A.D.” or “Travel to AD 3000”. 

The story is about [[Ye Bingyao]], a girl from the year 2011 who time-traveled to the year 3011, where androids that are indistinguishable from humans and humans with special powers have appeared. Caught within the conflict between various factions of the future, the girl struggles to be with the one she loves.

title: pickles_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Pickles[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. A black and white [[border collie]], Pickles possess a wiser and more philosophical mind compared to other dogs and humans. Pickles loves to talk about philosophy, but unable to express it because its fellow dogs are not as wise. Pickles receive a Dog Language-to-Human Language translator from [[Apple_(reverse:1999)|Mr. Apple]], although the translation result are sometimes different from what Pickles' mean. Pickles is one of the main character in the event [b]The Theft of the Rimet Cup[/b].

Pickles was based on "real life dog that found the missing Rimet Cup":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pickles_(dog)].

The translator Pickles use are voiced by [[Saito Soma]], while the English voice actor are yet to be revealed...

h4. Appearance
* !post #6815641: Default

title: alonso_quixano
body:
Main protagonist of [[Don Quixote (novel)|]].

[b]Alonso Quijano[/b], also known as [b]Alonso Quixano[/b], [b]Don Quijote[/b] or [b]Don Quixote[/b], is an Hidalgo (member of the lowest nobility) from the [[spain|Spanish]] reign of La Mancha who reads so many chivalric romances that he [[crazy|loses his mind]] and decides to become a [[knight]]-errant ([i]caballero andante[/i]) to revive [[chivalry]] and serve his nation and his kingdom.

He is a very tall and skinny middle age [[beard]]ed man who wears a rusty [[armor]] and wields a twisted [[sword]]. He is often depicted wearing a [[basin|shaving basin]] as a makeshift helmet.

h4. Derivative characters

* [[Don Quixote (FATE)]]
* [[Don Quixote (Project MOON)]]

title: okita_sougo
body:
A character in [[Gintama]], modeled after [[Okita Souji]].

He's the best swordsman in the [[shinsengumi_(gintama)|Shinsengumi]]. Although he is a master of kenjutsu, he frequently uses a bazooka. He tends to be light-hearted and somewhat childish, though his speech is heavily deadpan.

In comparison to [[Hijikata Toushirou|Hijikata]], Okita is very lazy when it comes to his job as he is often seen taking naps when he is supposed to work. He is also known as a sadist, being highly skilled in torturing people.

title: peppepe
body: A [[rubber duck]]-based Badnik—a type of [[robot]]ic enemy—in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], Peppepe first appeared in the game [i][[Sonic Labyrinth]][/i]. In this title, it rolls around and releases sticky, glue-like puddles that can immobilize [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] until he uses a Spin Dash to defeat it.

title: buzz_bomber
body:

Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], they fly overhead and fire projectiles at [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] and friends. They’ve appeared in many titles—from the first [[Sonic the Hedgehog 1|16‑bit Sonic the Hedgehog game]] to later releases like [i][[Sonic Generations]][/i] and [i][[Sonic Lost World]][/i].

Known as "Beeton" in Japan.

title: sonic_labyrinth
body: A 1995 isometric puzzle/action game in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. The game puts a unique spin on the traditional Sonic formula. In Sonic Labyrinth, [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] is forced to wear "Slow Down Boots" that strip away his signature speed and jumping ability, leaving his spin dash as the sole method of movement.

body:

In this form, Metal Sonic is powered up by a massive Dark Ring, which causes him to become much larger and adopt a red, more menacing appearance compared to his standard blue form.

title: crossbone_gundam_x-1
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Crossbone Gundam]].

[b]XM-X1 (F97) Crossbone Gundam X-1[/b]

A custom, pirate stylised mobile suit developed for the [[Crossbone Vanguard]] to be used in the Jupiter Sphere. 

To account for the extreme gravitational pull of Jupiter, it was given a revolutionary X-shaped thruster arrangement that kept the power high and the weight low, granting it fantastic mobility in [[jupiter_(planet)|Jupiter]]'s orbit - and had the additional effect of causing the unit to be borderline out of control in the weaker gravity of [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]. 

It was primarily piloted by [[Kincade Nau]].
other_names: クロスボーンガンダムX1

title: remote_robot_(tails_adventure)
body: Remote Robot, also known in Japanese as "Mecha Tails," is a small, remote-controlled [[drone]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] built in the likeness of [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]]. It first appears in the game [i][[Tails Adventure]][/i], where Tails uses it for reconnaissance and item collection. Because of its compact size and flying ability, the Remote Robot can navigate narrow passages that Tails himself can’t access. It even has the ability to transform into a one-man submarine called the Sea Fox for aquatic missions. Although it doesn’t have any offensive capabilities, it plays a crucial role in puzzle solving and exploration by keeping Tails safe while in use.

title: tails_adventure
body: A 2D side‐scrolling platform game in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], released in 1995 for the Sega Game Gear. In this game, [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]]’s sidekick [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]] embarks on his first solo adventure on Cocoa Island, where he must navigate 12 non-linear levels, collect various gadgets and bombs, and gather Chaos Emeralds to enhance his abilities while fighting off the invading Battle Kukku Empire.
other_names: テイルスアドベンチャー

title: sol_emerald
body:
A set of seven gemstones in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. They exist in the Sol Dimension, a parallel dimension to [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]]'s, and are a counterpart of the [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].
The Sol Emeralds are guarded by [[Blaze the Cat]], who can transform into [[Burning Blaze]] when using all seven of them.

title: jeweled_scepter_(sonic)
body: A mystical, ancient relic that first appears in [i][[Sonic Rush Adventure]][/i]. It’s an ornate [[scepter]]—resembling a shepherd’s hook and adorned with various colored [[jewel]]s—that originates from the Sol Dimension, serving as the national treasure of the Sol Empire. For generations, [[Blaze the Cat]]’s royal family has guarded it, as it holds the key to unleashing the "Power of the Stars," a cosmic energy that not only governs geological activity (such as triggering earthquakes and volcanic eruptions) but also sustains and connects parallel universes.

title: gardon_(sonic)
body: An anthropomorphic koala who serves as [[Blaze the Cat]]’s personal guard in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. He first appears in [i][[Sonic Rush Adventure]][/i] as a dedicated member of the Coconut Crew from the Sol Dimension. Gardon is known for his loyalty and skilled swordsmanship, often helping Blaze on her quests—such as recovering the [[Jeweled Scepter (Sonic)|Jeweled Scepter]] and locating the [[Sol Emerald]]s—while showing deep respect by addressing her formally. His character has also been featured in various Sonic comics published by Archie Comics and IDW Publishing.

title: classic_amy
body:
The younger, more single-mindedly infatuated, and less combative variant of [[Amy Rose]] introduced [[Sonic CD|Sonic the Hedgehog CD]].

* Shirt: A short-sleeved, green shirt or top with a white, pointed, Peter Pan collar.
* Skirt: A bright orange, pleated skirt that flares outward.
* Shoes: Light blue sneakers with a white stripe down the middle and white soles. The shoes have orange laces tied in bows.
* Gloves: White gloves.

title: bkub_(vtuber)
body:
A Japanese-speaking [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] avatar of artist [[bkub]], used when streaming on YouTube. Originally an [[adoptable]] avatar known as Shota Saburou or Shota Mimi-kun, designed by [[Okogemaru Nekosuke]], with Live2D by [[Shigehiro]], before being "purchased":[https://nizima.com/Item/DetailItem/38838] by bkub.

He's a 'shitty middle-aged miyakko [[animal ears|kemomimi]] shota', with blue-ish black-ish hair, stretching from his animal ears down to his short hair, with [[swept bangs]] and [[short eyebrows]], and [[black eyes]]. He has a [[blue tail|tail]] from which heart-shaped leaves are growing. He's depicted wearing [[round eyewear|round]], [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]] in a [[blue shirt|dark]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[school uniform]], featuring a [[black bow|black]] [[bowtie]], and a [[single wrist cuff]].

title: dancer_(fire_emblem:_three_houses)
body:
The [[dancer]] class as depicted in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Notably, in contrast to the dancer's depiction in other [[Fire Emblem]] games, the dancer class in [i]Three Houses[/i] has a notable [[ancient greek clothes|Greek]]/[[roman clothes|Roman]]-styled attire as opposed to the [[arabian clothes|Arabian]] style seen in other entries of the series.

The male variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[tunic]], while the female variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[single-shoulder dress]]; both attires are usually white for most characters by default. The outfit also includes a [[choker]] around the neck, [[armlet]]s and [[bracelet]]s on the arms, a [[belly chain]] around the waist, and a pair of [[sandals]].

title: hero_(dq10)
body: The [b]Hero[/b] is the protagonist of [[Dragon Quest X]]. He is completely customizable, though his default human appearance tends to have short [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. At the beginning of the game, he loses his human appearance and is granted to opportunity to reclaim it by reincarnating as one of 5 in-universe races: [[Ogre (dq10)|Ogre]], [[Puklipo]], [[Weddie (dq10)|Weddie]], [[Elf (dq10)|Elf]], and [[Dwarf (dq10)|Dwarf]]. He is able to also become a [[demon]] for one arc. His appearance as a separate race is also customizable. [Spoiler] Later in the story, he is revealed to be the son of [[Marone (dq10)|Marone]] and [[Padre (dq10)|Padre]]. [/Spoilers] h4. Official art * !post #9068973: Default Human appearance alongside the [[Heroine_(dq10)|Heroine]] and [[Galapagod]] * !post #8485523: Default Ogre appearance * !post #8421679: Default Elf appearance * !post #9074872: Default Weddie appearance * !post #9074895: Default Dwarf appearance * !post #9074928: Default Puklipo appearance

title: heroine_(dq10)
body: The [b]Heroine[/b] is the female version of the [[Hero (DQ10)|Hero]] that is playable in [[Dragon Quest X]]. Like the Hero, she is completely customizable, though her default human appearance tends to have long [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. At the beginning of the game, she loses her human appearance and is granted to opportunity to reclaim it by reincarnating as one of 5 in-universe races: [[Ogre (dq10)|Ogre]], [[Puklipo]], [[Weddie (dq10)|Weddie]], [[Elf (dq10)|Elf]], and [[Dwarf (dq10)|Dwarf]]. She is able to also become a [[demon]] for one arc. Her appearance as a separate race is also customizable. [Spoiler] Later on in the game's story, she is revealed to be the daughter of [[Marone (dq10)|Marone]] and [[Padre (dq10)|Padre]]. [/Spoiler] h4. Official art * !post #9068973: Default Human appearance alongside the Hero and [[Galapagod]] * !post #8421705: Default Elf appearance * !post #9068931: Default Ogre appearance * !post #8399613: Default Weddie appearance * !post #9074915: Default Dwarf appearance

title: woven_hatching
body:
Woven hatching is a shading technique where the artist uses short sets of parallel marks in one direction, then an adjacent group of parallel marks in an almost perpendicular direction to add shade to the art piece.The effect looks woven or like a basket when done well.

Note that this tag is [u]not[/u] mutually exclusive with other subtypes of [[hatching (texture)|hatching]], an artist may use [[linear hatching]] or [[crosshatching]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25281408: Woven hatching
* !post #7149716
* !post #4331051: Linear hatching, woven hatching and crosshatching.

h4. See also

* [[Hatching (texture)]]
** [[Linear hatching]]
** [[Crosshatching]]

title: inuyasha_(character)
body:
The titular character and main male protagonist of [[InuYasha]]. Has [[dog ears]] due to being half dog youkai.

He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: saotome_ranma
body:
Title character of [[Ranma 1/2]]. He's an expert martial artist who was born male, but a curse from falling into a magic spring made him turn into a girl ([[Ranma-chan]]). Whenever he gets soaked with cold water he transforms into [[Ranma-chan]] and he changes back when he gets soaked from hot water. He also has an aversion to cats as a result of training in "Cat Fu".

Thanks to his father, he has two fiancés: [[Tendou Akane]] and [[Kuonji Ukyou]]. Is also loved by [[Shampoo (Ranma 1/2)|]]. Seen as rival in love by [[Hibiki Ryouga]], [[Mousse (ranma 1/2)|]] and [[Kunou Tatewaki]].

Family: Father [[Saotome Genma]] and Mother [[Saotome Nodoka]]
He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: kudou_shin'ichi
body:
The original identity of [[Edogawa Conan]], Shin'ichi is a high-school detective who was forced to take a poison that should have killed him, but unexpectedly shrunk him into a child. He secretly pursues the Black Organization that caused this in order to heal his deformity and to bring them to justice. There are occasions when Shin'ichi returns to his regular age in order to fool his childhood friend [[Mouri Ran]] so she doesn't think he's either dead or is Conan.

His name comes from fictional detective [[Kudou Shunsaku (tantei monogatari)|]] and science fiction writer [[Hoshi Shin'ichi]].

He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: king_boo
body:
The king of all [[Boo (mario)|]]s in the [[Mario (series)|]] series. He debuted in [[Luigi's Mansion]], where he served as the main villain and final boss.

Since then, he has appeared in numerous Mario spinoff games (such as [[Mario Kart]]) and has reprised his role as the villain in [[Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon]] and [[Luigi's Mansion 3]]. He is often shown as [[Luigi]]'s main nemesis, much like [[Bowser]] vs. [[Mario]].

title: cyber_sigilism
body: A tattooing and graphic design style often in thin and sharp, bold blackwork. It generally pulls inspiration from ancient tribal designs and abstract art, often with a cyber-dystopian twist. Running themes are technology, mysticism and symbols.

title: suzuhara_touji
body:

He is the Fourth Children selected to be the pilot of  [[eva_03|Evangelion Unit 03]]. At school he is said to act like a tough boy and stereotypical jock. He is friends with [[Aida Kensuke]], [[Horaki Hikari]], and [[Ikari Shinji]].

He  is voiced by [[Seki Tomokazu]].

body:

Modeled after Takasugi Shinsaku.

title: yoshida_shouyou
body:
A character from [i][[Gintama]][/i], modeled after "Yoshida Shouin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshida_Sh%C5%8Din].

The teacher at the dojo [[Sakata Gintoki]], [[Katsura Kotarou]], and [[Takasugi Shinsuke]] all attended when they were younger. Mentor and father figure to all three. 
He  is voiced by [[Yamadera Kouichi]].

[spoiler] He is decapitated during the Joi War by Gintoki himself, but turns out to be immortal and survives as [[Utsuro]]. The identity of "Yoshida Shouyou" is not his true self.[/spoiler]

title: repulse_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of HMS [i]Repulse[/i].

She has [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], a white [[capelet]], [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[crop top]] that leaves her with an exposed [[midriff]]. 

She is one of three ships the player starts the game with, alongside the player's selected starter ship and [[Long Island (Azur Lane)|]]. Her skill activation phrase, "Neratte Pon~," is well known for this reason.

Historically, HMS [i]Repulse[/i] was completed shortly after the Battle of Jutland, but had a fairly unremarkable history until the outbreak of the Second World War. In November 1941 the Royal Navy sent her and [[Prince of Wales (Azur Lane)|Prince of Wales]], alongside other vessels, to reinforce Singapore against Japanese attack. After the Attack on Pearl Harbor, the two were famously sunk by a large air attack by Japanese bombers, their air defences insufficient to stave off the assault.

title: forsen
body: Sebastian "Forsen" Fors is a popular Swedish [[twitch.tv|Twitch]] streamer. He initially gained widespread recognition within the [[StarCraft II]] and later the [[Hearthstone]] communities. He is now primarily known as a variety streamer, often playing games like [[PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds]] (PUBG) and [[Minecraft]], and for his highly engaged and meme-centric community, often referred to as "Bajs" or "Forsenboys".

title: iskandar_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Iskandar (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, he is only known by his web-board username "Sensha Otoko" ("Tank Man"). He is incredibly shy and cannot get a girlfriend, but falls in love with a girl known as [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]]. Sensha Otoko asks for romantic advice from his online buddies on Eirei Throne-Channel.

Sensha Otoko looks slightly different from Iskandar in that his hair is messier, and he wears [[glasses]].

* !post #1521074

title: medea_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Medea (caster) (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, Medea uses her own name as her online pseudonym. She is a former model betrayed by her boyfriend (implied to be [[Kuzuki Souichirou]]) and continues obsessing over him. [[sasaki kojirou (sensha otoko) (fate)|Sasaki Kojirou]] is her caretaker.

* !post #1154413

title: hungry_luma_(super_mario_galaxy)
body:
A pinkish [[Luma (mario)|]]. Unlike other Lumas they have a visible mouth, similar to [[Lumalee]]. If fed [[Star Bit]]s (or sometimes [[coin]]s), they will transform into a new planet or galaxy. 

h4. External links
* "Super Mario Wiki: Hungry Luma":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Hungry_Luma]

title: gilgamesh_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, he goes by the web-board username "Gil", and is a cool hikikomori stalker. He is lazy and unmotivated, preferring to stay indoors and collect [[Saber (fate)|]] posters and figurines. [[enkidu (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Enkidu-chan"]] is in love with Gil, but he doesn't seem to notice.

* !post #1449121

title: kitagawa_marin
body:
One of the main characters in [[Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru]]. She is a high school student who is not only popular but also has a passion for [[cosplay]], especially her [[Kuroe Shizuku|favorite character]], [[Kuroe Shizuku (cosplay)|]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[blonde hair]] to [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. She wears both [[earrings]] and several [[ear piercing|piercing]]s, (including an [[industrial piercing]]), a [[black collar]] or  [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker]], [[bracelet]], [[necklace]], and a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] or [[grey necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

Other Attire: [[Halterneck]] [[black bikini|black]] [[string bikini|string]] [[side-tie bikini bottom|side-tie]] [[bikini]] with a [[floral print]]

Voiced by: [[Suguta Hina]] (JPN), [[Monarch_(amalee)|Amanda "AmaLee" Lee]] (ENG)

h4. External links

* "Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru Wiki: Kitagawa Marin":https://sono-bisque-doll-wa-koi-wo-suru.fandom.com/wiki/Marin_Kitagawa

body:
The 8th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]], revealed for and debuting during her first solo 3D concert [i]flower fantasista![/i] in 2024.

For this costume, she wears a [[pink dress|pink]] [[frilled dress]] decorated with flowers with a [[cleavage cutout]], [[white gloves]] and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[glass slippers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]] tied in [[two side up]] with a [[hair flower]] and a [[crown]].

title: left_4_dead
body:
A team-based first-person [[zombie]] shooter first developed by Turtle Rock Studios before being acquired by [[Valve Software]] to also work on the game together. It is set in 2008 after a viral pandemic which turns people into mutated, violent creatures hellbent on attacking uninfected humans.

The gameplay focuses on cooperating with your teammates to get to safety at the end of each map. There is also a team-based Versus Mode where up to 8 players compete against each other in teams of 4, Survivors and Infected, to see who can get the most points to win.

Was followed up by [[Left 4 Dead 2]].

h4. External links
* Wikipedia entry: "Left 4 Dead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Left_4_Dead]

title: reference_sheet
body:
An image depicting the details of a design. A reference sheet usually consists of [[multiple views]] of the same subject from different angles, with notes [[pointing out the details]] of the design, and sometimes with details such as clothing or accessories drawn separately for characters. The image often has the character with certain [[clothes on and off]].

For characters depicted in the same pose but in different clothing (as in post #1580637), use [[variations]].

This tag is for reference sheets of any subject. Use the [[weapon focus]] and [[vehicle focus]] tags alongside this one when appropriate.

h4. Examples

* !post #3705812

h4. See also

* [[character profile]]
* [[clothes variants]]
* [[color guide]]
* [[concept art]]
* [[equipment layout]]
* [[multiple expressions]]
* [[multiple views]]
* [[sprite sheet]]
* [[stats]]
* [[turnaround]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: sonic_adventure
body:
[b]Sonic Adventure[/b] (ソニックアドベンチャー [i]Sonikku Adobenchā[/i]) is a video game created by [[Sonic Team]] and released on 23 December [[1998]] in Japan for the [[sega dreamcast|Sega Dreamcast]] and the first main Sonic the Hedgehog game to feature 3D gameplay.

The story follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], [[Tails (Sonic)|]], [[Knuckles the Echidna|Knuckles]], [[Amy Rose]], newcomers [[Big the Cat]] and [[E-102 Gamma]], in their quests to collect the seven [[Chaos Emerald]]s and stop series antagonist [[Dr. Eggman|Dr. Robotnik]] from unleashing [[Chaos (Sonic)|Chaos]], an ancient evil. Controlling one of the six characters, with each with their own special abilities, players explore a series of themed levels to progress through the story.

It received a sequel in [[2001]], [[Sonic Adventure 2]], marking the 10th anniversary of the Sonic the Hedgehog series. In [[2003]], it received an enhanced port for the [[Gamecube|Nintendo GameCube]] and [[computer|PC]] titled [b]Sonic Adventure DX: Director's Cut[/b] (or [b]Deluxe[/b] in Japan).

h4. External links
* "Sonic Retro: Sonic Adventure":https://info.sonicretro.org/Sonic_Adventure
* "Wikipedia: Sonic Adventure":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Adventure
other_names: ソニックアドベンチャー
ソニックアドベンチャーDX

title: ribon_(shueisha)
body:
[[Shueisha]]'s shoujo manga [[magazine (object)|]], first published in 1955. It shares rivalry with shoujo anthology books [[Nakayoshi]] and Ciao. While not as widely known as [[Shounen Jump]] overseas, the magazine has enjoyed many well-known anime adaptations of its manga over the years, and remains widely circulated to this day.

The label [i]Ribon Mascot Comics[/i], with its distinctive pastel four-color ribbon on their collected tankoubons, is the magazine's imprint.

title: odin_sphere
body:
Odin Sphere is a 2D action video game with RPG elements. The game has five playable characters, each one with a different story. The characters were designed and illustrated by [[Kamitani George]].

It was developed by [[Vanillaware]] and published by Atlus for the [[Playstation 2]] in 2007. A remake, called Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir, was later released in 2016 for Sony's [[Playstation 3]], [[Playstation 4]] and [[Playstation Vita]].

h4. Characters

h6. Major Characters

* [[Gwendolyn (odin sphere)|]]

title: longcat_(meme)
body:
[i]Longcat is looooooong.[/i]

An exceptionally long, female [[white cat]] that became an internet [[meme]]. The original photo features her owner [[holding animal|holding her]] in an [[armpit carry]], demonstrating her length.

Her real name was [[Shiro (cat)|]] (シロ, lit. "White"), a stray cat found in the streets and adopted by her human. On [[2channel]], she was known as Nobiiru (のびーる, from [i]nobiru[/i], which means to stretch or extend). On [[4chan]] and the western Internet, she was known as Longcat.

She died on "September 20, 2020.":[https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345] ("Archive of Tweet":https://web.archive.org/web/20200920053331/https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345)

h4. Examples

* !asset #22729844: Origin

h4. See also

* [[Tacgnol]], a long black cat, evil version of Longcat

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Longcat":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/longcat

title: maximum_overdrive
body:
Maximum Overdrive is a 1986 American horror film written and directed by Stephen King, in his only directorial effort. The film stars Emilio Estevez, Pat Hingle, Laura Harrington, and Yeardley Smith. The screenplay was inspired by and loosely based on King's short story "Trucks", which was included in the author's first collection of short stories, Night Shift, and follows the events after all machines (including trucks, radios, arcade games, vending machines, etc.) become sentient when Earth crosses the tail of a comet, initiating a worldwide killing spree.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_Overdrive

title: last_origin
body:
A Korean turn-based mobile strategy RPG developed by Sigma Works and published by Smartjoy, launched in January 2019. A Japanese version launched in 2020. There has been no recent news on a release date for an English-language global version .

The game's setting is a world where human civilization has crumbled. The remaining human survivors work together with [[Auto Guard System]] robots and artificial humans called Bioroids to defend the planet against the [[Ironworm]]s, alien parasites of unknown origin.

Became popular (as well as infamous) in the Korean community, thanks to its many [[revealing_clothes|suggestive]] character designs during its introduction by regular artists such as [[snowball22|Snowball]] and [[Kakiman]], as well as collab artists [[Asanagi]] and [[Obui]]. After the uncensored version's re-rating to adult only in Korea around August 2024, the game has since introduced numerous sexually explicit character design and skins.

h4. See also

* [[List of Last Origin characters]]

h4. External links

title: laputa_robot
body:
An iconic [[robot]] from the movie [[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa|Laputa: Castle in the Sky]]. It has a peaked head with mismatched sockets for eyes (one small, one large), a large chest curving down to a small hip, and flat, segmented limbs. Its arms are long enough to extend down to the ground and each segment also has [[spines]]. It has an earthy, metallic color (grey or dark brown).

The Japanese term for the robot is literally "robot soldier", though a non-military type has also been shown. This one lacks spines and has a more greener color.
